content.p: If you're graduating in 2025, you might have a mix of emotions about the future. From excitement and anticipation through to uncertainty and anxiety! Whatever your situation, we're here to help. We've put together the answers to a list of questions we get asked by students plus four easy steps to help you move forward. Want to speak to an adviser? Book an appointment through MyCareer. Four actions to get your started What's your question for us? Do I need to choose a career now for life? I don't know what I want to do after my course. What can I do now? Should I focus on my course or applying for jobs and postgraduate courses? My CV is looking a little bare, what can I do? Iâ€™m interested in something that has nothing to do with my degree, how do I get in? Where do I look for job vacancies? When do I apply for a master's or PhD? Should I share my disability with an employer? I want to take some time out after my degree. Is this a good idea? I'm at international student interested in working in the UK. How do I find out about opportunities? I'm interested in working abroad after I graduate. Where can I find out about opportunities? Here are four ways you can get in touch with us. Follow us on Instagram @uoncareers Careers support for students and alumni of MBA, MSc and PhD programmes. Business School Postgraduate Careers team Gain a glimpse into topics with our bite-sized articles Sign up for Jobs by email to explore jobs and internships Chat to employers on campus about their graduate vacancies Gain career insights and develop your job-hunting skills telephone: +44 (0) 115 951 3680 fax: +44 (0) 115 951 3679 email: careers-team@nottingham.ac.uk
